oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dance fantasy is given at Shillinglaw’s, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940): “An attractive annual entertainment was the outdoor play given by Mr. and Mrs. R. A. Shillinglaw on the lawns of their home in Belle Meade. About 250 invited guests enjoyed the play, a dance fantasy, Friday evening. Albertine, who directed the program, is seen making up one of the dancers. Above is a section of the audience. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shillinglaw, R. A.
Shillinglaw, R. A.; Maxwell, Albertine (Ellen Albertine Chaiser), 1902-1996
